newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Bonino pledges to review EU consumer legislation.
newsitem.headline: Bonino pledges to review EU consumer legislation.

text.p: Consumer Affairs Commissioner Emma Bonino pledged on Tuesday to review EU consumer legislation to see how it can keep pace with developments in the information society.

In a speech to the European Consumer Forum in Dublin, she said regulations may be needed to require parties to a transaction to be clearly identified and their responsibilities outlined before the transaction can take place.

She also vowed to investigate whether current rules on advertising and the amount of information about products or services will be sufficient for the information society and how contractual obligations can be guaranteed.

She pointed to the need for rapid adoption of the distance selling directive, COM(96)36, and the possibility of extending to other areas the safeguards on consumer redress laid down in the directive applying Open Network Provision principles to voice telephone.
